title: 5 things to do for Halloween
text:
5 things to do for Halloween Last updated 05:00, October 25 2015 ANDREW KELLY 
Presidential candidate Donald Trump is a popular Halloween costume choice in the US this year. 
Get into the spooky spirit and have some fun this October 31. 
5. Go on a ghost tour 
Maybe your local theatre is haunted. Or perhaps your favourite restaurant used to be a morgue. Ghost tours are the perfect way to scare yourself silly while also learning interesting facts about the history of your city. 
4. Sleep aboard a pirate ship 
If ghosts aren't really your thing, consider spending a night aboard a pirate ship. GetMyBoat , known as the Airbnb for boats, offers a variety of options that will get you feeling like Captain Jack Sparrow in no time. 
3. Celebrate Day of the Dead 
This Mexican holiday is gaining popularity. While it traditionally commemorates friends and family who have died, it's also an opportunity to paint your face like a sugar skull and knock back the sangria. 
2. Dress up 
It's not just for kids. Whether it be your favourite movie character, a political figure, or a faithful old witch, get into costume and head to a Halloween party. 
1. Watch a scary movie 
Many cinemas play classic, cringeworthy slashers at Halloween. Head along for a scream on the big screen. Or get yourself some microwave popcorn and watch at home. - Stuff
